CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function unique_name_701 is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is because it directly uses user input in the update method without properly sanitizing it. An attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts by manipulating the value of $F(u), leading to various types of attacks such as stealing sensitive information, session hijacking, or defacement of the website.
